alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Southampton; Suffolk; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 9:31PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of northeastern Northampton, Gates, northwestern Currituck, northwestern Camden, northwestern Pasquotank, Hertford, southern Isle of Wight, and southeastern Southampton Counties, the City of Norfolk, the southeastern City of Poquoson, the City of Chesapeake, the City of Hampton, the southern City of Newport News, the City of Franklin, the City of Portsmouth, the City of Suffolk and the City of Virginia Beach through 1015 PM EST... At 930 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Crittenden to 6 miles southwest of Franklin to 8 miles east of Halifax. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Newport News, Hampton, Franklin, Murfreesboro, Windsor, Gatesville, Langley AFB, Ocean View, Virginia Wesleyan University, Regent University, Great Bridge, South Mills, Deep Creek, Downtown Portsmouth, Churchland, Norfolk State University, Sunbury, Kempsville and Hampton University. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Southampton; Suffolk; Virginia Beach
